articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Matthias Williams, Thomas Escritt
articles.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz delivered his most severe rebuke of Israel to date, criticising massive air strikes on Gaza as no longer justified by the need to fight Hamas and "no longer comprehensible".
articles.title: Germany shifts tone on Israel over 'incomprehensible' Gaza carnage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia is continuing to work on the draft memorandum setting out the principles of a possible future peace accord to end the war in Ukraine, Russia's foreign ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia still working on draft peace memorandum, says foreign ministry

articles.author: Phil Noble, Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Four people were "very, very ill in hospital" after a car ploughed into a crowd of Liverpool fans during a Premier League title parade, the city's mayor said, adding that he hoped they would "pull through."
articles.title: Four people injured in Liverpool parade crash 'very, very ill,' mayor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Turkey's foreign minister discussed at a meeting in Moscow efforts to end the war in Ukraine and developments since direct talks between the warring parties, a Turkish Foreign Ministry source said.
articles.title: Putin and Turkish foreign minister discuss Ukraine peace efforts, source says

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: India's defence minister has approved a framework for building the country's most advanced stealth fighter jet.
articles.title: India approves stealth fighter programme amid tensions with Pakistan

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The wife of South Korea's main conservative party candidate has taken a leading role ahead of next week's elections, campaigning on her own to tarnish the image of the liberal frontrunner and his spouse and turbocharge her husband's bid.
articles.title: Candidate spouses take centre stage in South Korea's heated presidential race

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea's minister of state security, Ri Chang Dae, left Pyongyang on Monday to attend a meeting of senior security officials in Russia, the North's KCNA state news agency reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea's state security minister to attend high-level meeting in Russia, KCNA says

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The work of a U.S.-backed private humanitarian organization tasked with distributing aid in Gaza is a distraction from what is needed, such as the opening of crossing points, a U.N. spokesperson said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Gaza humanitarian group is a 'distraction' from what is needed, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Tuesday flooding in the southeast posed "massive challenges" and the recovery would take several months.
articles.title: Australia floods recovery could take several months, PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A previously unknown Russian hacking group was behind attacks last year on the networks of the Dutch police, NATO and several European countries, Dutch intelligence agencies said.
articles.title: Russia-backed group hacked into networks of police and NATO, say Dutch authorities
